Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of six lines of Greek text written in black ink. Joint to EA 66269.
Curator's comments: Joins EA 66269 Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393798) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393798)
